titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mulvey Family Papers AIA.043
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-12-11T09:58-0500

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box and 1 oversize folder in a shared box

did.abstract: This collection consists of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey’s first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. Elizabeth Mulvey was a teacher and later public school principal in the Bronx. Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kathleen Mulvey, 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.032.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Kathleen Mulvey, the sister-in-law of Elizabeth Mulvey, were transferred to New York University in 1999. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey’s first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included visits to Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Mulvey was born in the Bronx to a family of Irish immigrants: her father was a carpenter born in the Bronx and her mother was born in Wicklow. Mulvey worked as a teacher and later the principal of a public school in the Bronx.
Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Mulvey Family Papers; AIA 043; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
